content:
Command Line Tools
: simple terminal UI for git commands
: ncurses-based text-mode interface for git
: A utility tool powered by fzf for using git interactively
: A TUI Git client inspired by Magit
: Blazing fast terminal-ui for Git written in Rust
Manage Git history
: git commit --fixup, but automatic
git-filter-repo
:  Quickly rewrite git repository history (filter-branch replacement)
: Incremental merge for Git
: A syntax-aware git merge driver for a growing collection of programming languages and file formats.
git-branchless
: Branchless workflow for Git
Shell prompt integrations
These let you put your current Git branch (and more) in your shell prompt:
: The minimal, blazing-fast, and infinitely customizable prompt for any shell!
git-prompt.sh
: Bash prompt that comes with Git
Manage large files
: A syntax highlighting pager for Git diffs
: A structural diff that understands syntax
diff-so-fancy
: diff-so-fancy strives to make your diffs human readable instead of machine readable
Manage hooks
:  A framework for managing and maintaining multi-language pre-commit hooks.
: A fast Git hooks manager written in Go
Collections of Git tools
: Git repo summary, repl, changelog population, author commit percentages and more
git-toolbelt
: A suite of useful Git commands that aid with scripting or every day command line usage
: Fast git handover for remote pair/mob programming.
git-secrets
: Prevents you from committing secrets and credentials into git repositories
: Create committing rules for projects, auto bump versions and auto changelog generation
: Additional Git commands that automate the creation, synchronization, shipping, and cleanup of Git branches
